info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Fire Danger Increasing Again Across Southeastern Louisiana... State and federal fire weather officials have requested that citizens be extra vigilant tomorrow regarding increasing fire danger. Widespread severe to extreme drought, mostly sunny skies, winds of around 10 mph with gusts to 20 mph and low relative humidity will result in conditions that are favorable for the spread of any ongoing or new fires across extreme southeastern Louisiana. Elsewhere across the state a Red Flag Warning is in effect from 10 AM through 8 PM Wednesday due to the critical nature of the fire weather conditions away from the immediate coast. A strict burn ban remains in effect for all of Louisiana. All private, agricultural, and prescribed burning is prohibited with no exceptions. Other safety and prevention actions include: * Do not park vehicles on dry grass. * Ensure any trailer chains do not drag on pavement creating sparks. * Fully extinguish all cigarettes before disposing in a proper container. * Report any observed fires to 911 immediately.
